meta:twitter:creator: @BBCNews
intro_paragraph: The hairdresser's chair is a surprisingly intimate setting where discussions range far beyond holidays setting where discussions range far beyond holidays setting where discussions range far beyond holidays setting where discussions range far beyond holidays and weekend plans.
intro_paragraph_2: In salons from Beirut to Tokyo, London to Johannesburg, a simple haircut can spark frank conversations about what it means to be female now: stories of race, sexuality, age, class and dreams.
section_1_title: Tokyo: A tale with a tail
section_1_paragraph: Japan is undergoing a pet boom, and devoted owner Mami goes to a salon where her dog can get a trim at the same time. But Mami's love for her pet masks a story of loss and longing.
section_2_paragraph: Young Lebanese graduate Miriam is colouring her naturally-curly hair a deep red. It's an act of minor rebellion in a country where the style is for ultra-glamorous sleek, straight hair - and plastic surgery to match.
section_3_paragraph: Hair and identity are so entwined that hair loss can strike a heavy blow. Daniele and her hairdresser husband Graeme found it hard to cope when she lost her hair during chemotherapy for breast cancer.
section_3_blockquote: One of the first things I thought was â€˜oh my God, I'm going to lose my hair'
section_4_paragraph: In east London, Cameroonian Cece explains to stylist Pearl why she wants her natural hairstyle to show the world she is African. But the definition of natural is up for debate.
section_4_blockquote: My hair has to be big and rough with va-va-voom!
section_5_paragraph: Every area, rich or poor has its salons. In a shanty town in the Honeydew district of Johannesburg, Zimbabwean Sharon has set up shop in a shipping container. She has plenty of clients but finds life as a migrant worker tough.
credits:
Video production by Charlotte Pritchard, Christine Jeavans, Gertrude Kitongo, Kent De Pinto, Marwa al-Nagar, Neil Meads and Vibeke Venema.
